markdownRemark.html:
Have you ever tried to imagine how it must have been living in a small village before telecommunication was a thing?

Imagine the excitement of a new blacksmith, or a baker moving to your village, when previously there was none. Maybe someone who knows how to blow glass, or a doctor! Before Amazon and a pervasive network of transportation systems, the only things you would be able to have was what you made yourself, or what people in your phyisical proximity made (and were willing to trade).

Nowadays, especially if you live in a big city, it almost doesn’t matter who lives next to you: you will still have access to basically the same things as everybody else, which is perhaps the biggest factor in making your neighbours seem just a nuisance most of the time.
